sentence.Network_en: Hollywood was an uncongenial place to work.
sentence.Network_cn: 好莱坞是个不适宜工作的地方。

sentence.Network_en: He continued to find the Simpsons uncongenial bores.
sentence.Network_cn: 他依然觉得辛普森一家人很讨厌。

sentence.Network_en: The religious climate at the time was uncongenial to new ideas.
sentence.Network_cn: 当时的宗教气候容不得新思想。

PerfectNetExp.abs: unconformitytrap 不整合面圈闭, uncongenial 不同类的, uncongenial 不亲和的

uncongenial 不亲和的, uncongenial 不和合的, uncongenial 不同类的
The uncongenial roommates were always fighting ., 这些志趣不相投的室友经常吵架.

list.abs: to revolt against uncongenially banausic employment ., 反抗不合志趣的机械呆板的职业.

entry.def: If you describe a person or place as uncongenial, you mean that they are unfriendly and unpleasant.

example.ex: He continued to find the Simpsons uncongenial bores...
example.tran: 他依然觉得辛普森一家人很讨厌。

example.ex: Hollywood was an uncongenial place to work.
example.tran: 好莱坞是个不适宜工作的地方。

means.word_mean: 1. not suitable to your tastes or needs;

sentences.sentence: "the task was uncongenial to one sensitive to rebuffs"

means.word_mean: 2. very unfavorable to life or growth;
3. used of plant stock or scions; incapable of being grafted

auth_sentence.content: Refusing to habor such uncongenial guests.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Refusing to habor such uncongenial guests.

auth_sentence.content: Gravity was uncongenial to her, and she made light even of grave things.
